summary: Email chain regarding a request from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense counsel, Christian Everdell, to arrange for FBI agents to bring a secure laptop to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for Maxwell to review evidence. The emails coordinate scheduling a 3-hour window on the upcoming Friday.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP requesting FBI agents bring a secure laptop to the MDC for his client, Ghislaine Maxwell, to review evidence during a scheduled visit.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom the secure FBI laptop is being requested to be brought to the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for evidence review.

connections.description: Everdell is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, arranging for her to review evidence on an FBI laptop while she is detained.

events.title: Scheduled MDC Visit for Evidence Review
events.description: A visit is scheduled at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) for Ghislaine Maxwell to review evidence on a secure FBI laptop, with a requested 3-hour window from 11am to 2pm.

locations: New York, NY 10022 (Cohen & Gresser LLP office address)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Christian Everdell, requested FBI agents bring a secure laptop to the MDC for Maxwell to review evidence.
The request was for a specific 3-hour window on a Friday (likely October 30, 2020, given the email date of October 28, 2020).
The email chain shows coordination between Maxwell's legal team and (presumably) the U.S. Attorney's Office or FBI regarding evidence disclosure procedures.
The document highlights the logistical aspects of pre-trial evidence review while Maxwell was in federal detention.
The correspondence is marked as external and confidential, indicating formal legal communication.
